title: Generating data from imbalanced training data sets
abstract: Injecting generated data samples into a minority data class of an imbalanced training data set is provided. In response to receiving an input to balance the imbalanced training data set that includes a majority data class and the minority data class, a set of data samples is generated for the minority data class. A distance is calculated from each data sample in the set of generated data samples to a center of a kernel that includes a set of data samples of the majority data class. Each data sample in the set of generated data samples is stored within a corresponding distance score bucket based on the calculated distance of a data sample. Generated data samples are selected from a number of highest ranking distance score buckets. The generated data samples selected from the number of highest ranking distance score buckets are injected into the minority data class.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for injecting generated artificial data samples into a minority data class of an imbalanced training data set, the computer-implemented method comprising:
responsive to a computer receiving an input to balance the imbalanced training data set that includes a majority data class and the minority data class, generating, by the computer, a set of artificial data samples for the minority data class of the imbalanced training data set;
calculating, by the computer, a distance from each data sample in the set of generated artificial data samples to a center of a kernel that includes a set of data samples of the majority data class;
storing, by the computer, each data sample in the set of generated artificial data samples within a corresponding distance score bucket based on the calculated distance of a data sample;
selecting, by the computer, generated artificial data samples from a predetermined number of highest ranking distance score buckets; and
injecting, by the computer, the generated artificial data samples selected from the predetermined number of highest ranking distance score buckets into the minority data class to balance a size of the minority data class with a size of the majority data class.
2. The computer-implemented method of claim 1, further comprising:
utilizing, by the computer, an expectation maximization algorithm to determine a model that includes a number of kernels comprising data samples of the majority data class of the imbalanced training data set.
3. The computer-implemented method of claim 2, further comprising:
generating, by the computer, the number of kernels within the model based on the set of generated artificial data samples;
calculating, by the computer, a likelihood of the set of generated artificial data samples being included in the majority data class of the imbalanced training data set; and
updating, by the computer, parameters of each kernel in the number of kernels based on the likelihood of the set of generated artificial data samples being included in the majority data class of the imbalanced training data set.
4. The computer-implemented method of claim 3, further comprising:
adjusting, by the computer, each kernel in the number of kernels based on the updated parameters.
5. The computer-implemented method of claim 3, further comprising:
responsive to the computer determining that the likelihood of the set of generated artificial data samples being included in the majority data class is high, increasing, by the computer, the number of kernels in the model.
6. The computer-implemented method of claim 2, further comprising:
determining, by the computer, a minimum distance from each data sample in the set of generated artificial data samples to the center of a nearest kernel in the number of kernels; and
utilizing, by the computer, the minimum distance corresponding to each data sample in the set of generated artificial data samples as a distance score for a respective data sample.
7. The computer-implemented method of claim 6, further comprising:
calculating, by the computer, a maximum distance for the set of generated artificial data samples; and
discarding, by the computer, data samples in the set of generated artificial data samples having a determined minimum distance equal to or greater than the calculated maximum distance for the set of generated artificial data samples.
8. The computer-implemented method of claim 6, further comprising:
generating, by the computer, a number of buckets that are ranked in descending order from a highest distance score bucket to a lowest distance score bucket, wherein each bucket in the number of buckets stores generated artificial data samples having distance scores within a predetermined range of distance scores associated with that particular bucket.
9. The computer-implemented method of claim 2, wherein the model is a Gaussian mixture model.
10. The computer-implemented method of claim 9, wherein a set of one or more minority data classes provide constraints on the Gaussian mixture model.
11. The computer-implemented method of claim 1, wherein the calculated distance is a calculated Mahalanobis distance.
12. The computer-implemented method of claim 1, wherein each generated artificial data sample in the minority data class and each data sample in the majority data class includes a label to identify a data sample.
13. A computer system for injecting generated artificial data samples into a minority data class of an imbalanced training data set, the computer system comprising:
a bus system;
a storage device connected to the bus system, wherein the storage device stores computer readable program code; and
a processor unit connected to the bus system, wherein the processor unit executes the computer readable program code to generate a set of artificial data samples for the minority data class of the imbalanced training data set in response to receiving an input to balance the imbalanced training data set that includes a majority data class and the minority data class; calculate a distance from each data sample in the set of generated artificial data samples to a center of a kernel that includes a set of data samples of the majority data class; store each data sample in the set of generated artificial data samples within a corresponding distance score bucket based on the calculated distance of a data sample; select generated artificial data samples from a predetermined number of highest ranking distance score buckets; and inject the generated artificial data samples selected from the predetermined number of highest ranking distance score buckets into the minority data class to balance a size of the minority data class with a size of the majority data class.
